data.title: Events — Williams Center
data.meta_description: The Williams center in Rutherford, New Jersey., is an arts and cultural center, cinema complex and events venue offering: Film screenings, concerts, comedy, film and fringe festivals, multimedia production studio and, event space.
data.text:
Board Game Night

A weekly casual gathering in the Atrium of the 100-year old Williams Center of Rutherford, NJ. The event is centered around playing contemporary boardgames of various types. Bring a game and a friend!

Here is a list of our current boardgames: https://docs.google.com/document/d/12xLd0a7dCjyqgVpD8a_7X66ZdIAfxonv-Dr4yQx9qSc/edit?usp=sharing

View Event →

Scarface

Brian De Palma's iconic remake of the 1932 Howard Hawks classic. Written By Oliver Stone and starring Al Pacino as Tony Montana, a Cuban immigrant who quickly rises to power in Miami's drug underworld, is a neon-soaked vision of 80s excess. Struggling to balance power with paranoia, Tony finds out that holding on to his newfound empire is harder than building it, and he must be willing to do the unthinkable to keep it safe within his grip.

View Event →

Hundreds of Beavers

The film industry’s biggest cult hit of the year has invaded Cinema Underground! When an applejack salesman’s life is turned upside down by conniving beavers, he begins life anew as an aspiring fur trapper, eager stake his claim in the wilderness. However, he quickly finds himself underestimating the critters’ unrelenting army, falling headfirst into a rabbit hole of absurd comedic antics. Fusing the black and white silent cinema aesthetics of Charlie Chaplin with the animated slapstick of the Looney Tunes, this bonkers woodland adventure is unlike anything you’ve ever seen before.

Other Showtimes:

August 17 at 7 PM

August 24 at 2 PM

August 24 at 7 PM

View Event →

All-Star Comedy Lineup: The Next Big Thing

*Doors at 8pm, Show at 8:30pm*

Hatem Gabr presents The Next Big Thing, an All-Star Standup Comedy Show, starring some of the nation's hottest comedians.

Two nights a month at the Williams Center!

Liz Glazer

Liz is a standup comedian who used to be a tenured law professor. She's won festivals (Boston Comedy Festival and Ladies of Laughter first place winner), released an album that debuted at #1 on the iTunes comedy charts and stayed there for 6 consecutive days, headlined, and sold out shows at New York Comedy Festival, and recently taped a set for Don't Tell Comedy.

Lou Perez

Comedian, writer, and producer. Lou is a regular on Gutfeld!, Fox, and Open to Debate. He's the author of bestseller “That Joke Isn't Funny Anymore” and his writing appears in The Wall Street Journal, The Spectator, and Spiked magazine. Lou hosts The Lou Perez Podcast and The Wrong Take debate series. Lou was the head writer and producer of the Webby Award-winning comedy channel We the Internet TV and produces Comedy Is Murder with Free the People.

Dan Naturman

Finalist - NBC's America's Got Talent. Four appearances on The Late Show with David Letterman, Conan, The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson, The Tonight Show, Late Night with Conan O'Brien, his own "Comedy Central Presents..." special, HBO’s Crashing, and had multiple appearances on Comedy Central’s, "This Week at The Comedy Cellar" .

Laura High

Laura headlines all around the country and has featured in the SLO Comedy Festival, North Carolina Comedy Festival, She-Devil Comedy Festival, 365 Comedy Festival and New York Comedy Festival. You may also be one of Laura's 623,000 followers on TikTok where she uses her comedy to do advocacy for the donor conceived community and exposes the Fertility Industry.

*Line up is subject to change without notice.*

View Event →

Studio Ghibli Sundays: My Neighbor Totoro

Other showtimes:

August 18 at 8 PM

*Presented in the original Japanese with English subtitles*

Back by popular demand, the Williams Center invites you to “Studio Ghibli Sundays,” a year-long series in which we dedicate one night a week to screening and celebrating the works of Studio Ghibli.

Miyazaki’s seminal work for Studio Ghibli became such a sensation that its title character – a forest spirit whose animal classification remains undefined – has since become the studio’s mascot. The surrounding film, a deeply spiritual work from a filmmaker attempting to rediscover his country’s once-utopian wonder, follows two young sisters whose mother is recovering from illness. In moving to be closer to the hospital, they find escape in their new house’s surrounding forests, where a community of spirits whisk them away on exciting adventures.

View Event →

Amy

Moving and tragic in equal measure, Amy chronicles Amy Winehouse’s short but singular career. Set to audio interviews and archival material, including previously unseen footage, the documentary is as much an exploration of the British soul singer’s alluring artistry as it is the forces that dismantled it, including Winehouse’s own struggles with bulimia and substance abuse. Unflinchingly honest but never exploitative, Amy honors one of music’s lost icons by telling her story with authenticity and vulnerability.

Other showtimes:

August 19 at 8:30 PM

View Event →

Amy

Set to audio interviews and archival material, including previously unseen footage, the documentary is as much an exploration of the British soul singer’s alluring artistry as it is the forces that dismantled it, including Winehouse’s own struggles with bulimia and substance abuse. Williams Center Open Mic

The Williams Center presents a weekly open-mic, $5 for spectators and participants.

Nothing is off-limits, and we encourage artists of all disciplines and ages to come and hone their craft. Poetry, spoken word, singer song-writers, comedy and more! Performers will be in the Williams Center's "Spring Hall".

*Performers, Please make sure to identify your act when you get your ticket. Time slots are five minutes per artists, so please plan your acts accordingly. Make sure to fill out THIS FORM after purchasing a ticket!

View Event →

Space Adventure Cobra: The Movie

Space Adventure Cobra: The Movie is an alternate introduction to Buichi Terasawa’s seminal 1978 manga. After two years in hiding, Psycho Gun-wielding bounty hunter Cobra is brought back into the fray by Jane Flowers, a fellow hunter who believes he is the only one who can help save her two lost sisters. Filled with hilarious writing and fast-paced action, this psychedelic sci-fi romp is anchored by its protagonist’s Han Solo-meets-James Bond swagger.

View Event →

Araya

Poetry on celluloid. Praised as being a harbinger of Latin feminist cinema, Margot Benacerraf’s landmark film depicts salt laborers in Venezuela. Through three documentary stories woven together, the film captures menial, back-breaking work with unending scale and beauty, transporting audiences to a world far beyond the fast-paced technology of the modern world.

View Event →

Death Race 2000

Featuring a young Sylvester Stallone, this rarely-screened cult hit rampages through a dystopian future where America tunes in to an annual cross-country road race that rewards drivers for running over pedestrians as much as it does coming in first place. Meanwhile, a resistance plots to sabotage the race as an act of defiance against “Mr. President” and his regime. Outlandishly campy and violent, Roger Corman's uproarious screenplay set a standard for the explosion of grindhouse films in the 1970s.

View Event →

Nine Lives Paranormal Event

Prepare for an extraordinary evening where the realms of clairvoyance and ghost hunting intersect. This captivating event promises to engage your mind, stir your curiosity, and perhaps even send shivers down your spine. Whether you're a skeptic, a believer, or somewhere in between, this is an event you won't want to miss.

Event Highlights:

1. Fundraising Wine Tasting

Begin your evening with an elegant wine tasting session. Savor a selection of fine wines while mingling with fellow attendees. This sophisticated prelude not only sets the stage for the night's lectures but also supports a great cause, with 10% proceeds benefiting The Williams Center.

2. Session One: The Art and Science of Clairvoyance

Our first session delves into the mystical world of clairvoyance. Discover the history, methodologies, and modern interpretations of this ancient practice. Paranormal Investigator Cara Cilento, will guide you through the different types of clairvoyance, and its practical applications in daily life. Gain insights into how some individuals perceive events beyond the normal range of sensory contact and what this might mean about human consciousness and potential.

3. Session Two: The Intriguing World of Ghost Hunting

Transitioning from the realm of visions to the pursuit of spirits, our second session focuses on ghost hunting. Learn about the equipment, techniques, and investigative processes used by contemporary ghost hunters to detect paranormal activity. Ghost Hunter, Gail Gamble, will share captivating stories from his most compelling cases, reveal the challenges faced during investigations, and discuss the evidence that continues to fuel debates on the existence of the paranormal.

4. Ghost Hunt of the Venue

Conclude the night with an exhilarating ghost hunt within our historic venue, renowned for its ghostly lore and spectral sightings. Armed with ghost hunting gear and led by our expert speakers, you'll have the chance to participate in a live paranormal investigation. Experience the thrill of seeking out the unknown and possibly encountering the spirits that reside within these walls.

Why Attend?

- Educational Insight: Gain a profound understanding of clairvoyance and ghost hunting from leading experts.

- Unique Experience: Enjoy an immersive event that blends enlightening lectures with practical ghost hunting.

This event promises to be a night of discovery, excitement, and perhaps a touch of the supernatural. Whether you're there to learn, experience, or support, you'll leave with a deeper appreciation for the mysteries that surround us.

Tickets are limited, so reserve your spot today and join us for an evening where the boundaries between the known and the unknown blur.

Event Details:

- Date: 8/22/24

- Time: 7-10pm

- Venue: Williams Center

- Ticket Price: $50.00 (includes wine tasting and all lecture sessions)

Embark on a journey into the realms of clairvoyance and ghost hunting with us and discover what lies beyond the veil.

View Event →

Never Have I Ever Storytelling Show

Never Have I Ever is an Improvised Storytelling Show based off of the popular party game of the same name. Comedians will be given prompts of things that “they never have done before”. If they have done the thing before, they will tell an impromptu story or joke about their experience.

Audience members will have the opportunity to participate by submitting their own ‘Never Have I Ever’ prompts.

August 23rd, 2024 | Tickets : $15 | Location : Spring Hall

Doors : 7:30 PM | Show : 8 PM to 9:30 PM

August 23rd Lineup

Erin Wohlberg @Erin.Wohlz

(Hell Yea! Comedy)

Zach McMahon @ZachMcMahon1

(Uncle Vinnie’s Comedy Club, Say Cheese)

Kate Nichols @HeyKateNichols

(Westside Comedy Club, Edinburgh Fringe Fest)

T @T4vpsip

(Stoned Dojo, Comedy in Harlem)

Bios:

Erin Wohlberg (@erin.wohlz)

Erin can be seen in bars and clubs all over NJ as well as yelling at her children in grocery stores weekly. She is the co-producer of the Hell Yea! Comedy show in north Bergen and teaches people how to un-fuck themselves as a yoga teacher.

Zach McMahon (@ZachMcMahon1)

Zach is originally from California. He's a house MC at Uncle Vinnie's Comedy Club and Produces the Say Cheese Comedy Show in NYC.

Kate Nichols (@heykatenichols)

Kate Nichols is a stand up comedian who's performed internationally at the Edinburgh International Fringe Festival and for the US Army as part of the USO, opening for Chris Gethard, in addition to her regular local appearances in the NY and NJ comedy scene. She’s also a licensed clinical social worker and works professionally as a therapist specializing in trauma work with women and queer folks. She loves blending the worlds of comedy and mental health, as two sources for the human pursuit of making meaning out of our experiences to find greater connection to each other.

T (@t4vpsip)

T has performed all around the Tri-State area. He performed at Stoned Dojo, Broadway Comedy Club, Comedy in Harlem, Bar 13. He produces two shows at MK Valencia in Ridgefield Park and Fusion Lounge in Paterson along with two open mics at Kilkenny Ale House in Newark and Comedy in Harlem in New York. He's available for all of your parties and Bar Mitzvahs. T was born and raised with two brothers and two sisters in New Jersey. He's been doing comedy the past three years. He changes his age everyday from 35 to 62 years old. He tells stories about his experiences being half Native American and Brown in America. He likes to Sudoku.

View Event →

Animarum, Ender, Empty Vessel, Diamonds to Dust and Graypath at the WC

Heads up, metalheads! Get ready for an epic night of heavy tunes at The Black Box in the Williams Center, Rutherford, NJ. We've got a killer lineup that's gonna blow your mind.

Date: 8/23

Doors: 7 PM Show: 8 PM

Tickets: $20

Meet the Bands:

Animarum

Straight out of New Jersey, Animarum brings a fierce blend of modern death metal with progressive influences, creating a sound that's both brutal and intricate. Their relentless energy and complex compositions will leave you breathless and wanting more.

Ender

ENDER formed in 2009 and wasted no time in the scene by signing with the currently defunct Eulogy Recordings, releasing their debut EP “This Is Revenge”. Although the band does not actively tour, ENDER continues to release new music and perform throughout the tristate area.

Empy Vessel

An up and coming metal quintet from New Jersey specializing in 7 string progressive metalcore.

Diamonds to Dust

This Christian deathcore band from New York is dedicated to creating powerful music for the Lord Almighty. Signed to Manifest Records, Diamonds to Dust's latest EP, "Decisions," showcases their intense and faith-driven approach to deathcore. Prepare for a spiritual and sonic onslaught!

Graypath

Representing North Jersey, Graypath combines modern metalcore with deathcore influences to deliver a hard-hitting and aggressive sound. Their raw energy and brutal riffs are sure to ignite the crowd and keep the adrenaline pumping all night long.

Join us for a night of epic metal performances, camaraderie, and unforgettable memories. Don't miss out on this incredible event—get your tickets now and prepare to rock out at The Black Box!

See you there!

View Event →

ProgStock Presents: Nektar, with special guest Dave Bainbridge

The Nektar MISSION TO MARS 2024 Tour!

Buckle up music lovers, because Nektar is about to take you on the ride of a lifetime. From the furthest reaches of the galaxy to the depths of your soul, their music transcends time and space. The mission is clear, the destination unknown, inviting you to join them on a journey promising to be nothing short of extraordinary. Joining them for this very special show is the incredibly versatile multi-instrumentalist and composer, Dave Bainbridge, founder of IONA, and member of countless projects, such as Strawbs, Circuline, and Lifesigns.

NOTE: This is a General Admission show with both seated and standing-room options. There is also a VIP Experience Package which includes a ticket for a seat within the first two rows and these other perks:

Pre-Show Private SOUND CHECK

Exclusive Pre-Show MEET & GREET

PHOTO Opportunity

EXCLUSIVE MERCHANDISE Items:

NEKTAR TOTE Bag

Autographed Limited Edition POSTER

Commemorative VIP LAMINATE & Lanyard

EARLY ENTRY into the Venue

Crowd-Free Merch Shopping

On-site VIP Check-in Host (check-in begins at 5:30pm)

For over half a century, Nektar has been the guiding star for countless fans, leading them on mesmerizing expeditions through the vast expanses of the cosmos and the depths of the ocean. With their unique fusion of progressive rock and stunning visuals, these trailblazing prog-rock legends have ignited the imaginations of generations. And now, Nektar is poised to hit the road once again, bringing their legendary live experience to eager audiences across America's Northeast and Midwest this June, with additional dates slated for the end of August 2024.

Dubbed the "Mission to Mars" Tour, this eagerly anticipated journey marks Nektar's triumphant return to the stage, featuring a stellar lineup of fan-favorite "album sides" from their illustrious catalogue. From timeless classics like "A Tab in the Ocean", "Remember the Future", “Recycled” and “Sounds Like This” to the groundbreaking sounds of their 2020 acclaimed release of “The Other Side”, every performance is a testament to the band's enduring legacy. And let’s not forget the latest addition to their sonic arsenal – the hotly anticipated new album, "Mission to Mars," set to launch audiences into uncharted territory.

And speaking of magic, prepare to be amazed by the visual spectacle that accompanies every Nektar performance. With the passing of the torch from the legendary Mick Brockett, who has retired, to the dynamic Jay Petsko, the band's light show has undergone a digital revolution, promising an even more immersive experience for fans old and new. And in a poignant tribute to the late Ron Howden, Nektar welcomes Jay Dittamo on drums, handpicked by the maestro himself. It is a testament to the band's enduring spirit and unwavering dedication to their craft.

For those that are hungry for a taste of exclusive merchandise from their merch table, the band will be offering up their live CD/Blu Ray album, “Journey to The Other Side” and an incredibly special Limited-Edition Pre-Release of their new album, “Mission To Mars.” It's a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to experience the magic of Nektar in its purest form.

From their roots in Germany to the pinnacle of international fame, Nektar has remained true to their vision, remaining steadfast, and pushing the boundaries of what's possible in music. With a lineup featuring original member Derek 'Mo' Moore (bass guitar, vocals), alongside powerhouse talents, alumni member, Ryche Chlanda (guitars, vocals), Kendall Scott (keyboards, synths), Jay Dittamo (drums, percussion) and Maryann Castello (background vocals), the band continues to captivate audiences with their unmatched charisma and boundless creativity.

View Event →

Office Hours: A Roundtable Discussion for Rounding Out Ideas

Williams Center Presents:

'Office Hours: A Roundtable Discussion for Rounding Out Ideas'

Do you feel like you have an idea for a script / book / poem / song, and you just don't know how to get it off the ground? Or maybe you have a completed piece of work, and you simply want another person to give some honest feedback? Starting this August, the Williams Center is offering a brand-new forum for just that: your ideas!

We proudly present "Office Hours," an open-door, collaborative forum that helps each member work through the ideation, creation, and revisions of their latest artistic endeavor! It's a bi-weekly, two hour session where you can bring anything to the table, and you'll be met with full attention and constructive feedback.

To clarify, it is a group built on kindness, open-mindedness and timeliness — while everyone will have a chance to comment on each other's work, there will be proper guidelines and time constraints to give everyone a chance to share (more on that later). And to further clarify, you do not have to bring something for every session. Come and go as you please, and feel free to be in the room without the caveat of something you're working on.

All in all, we want this to feel like a meeting place for creatives who just want to be around other working creatives. While the focus might lean towards screenwriting or prose, we are open to all kinds of art, and this group will morph with time and experience.

Consider this your opportunity to get some work done — and let us help you get it there!

View Event →

Studio Ghibli Sundays: Kiki's Delivery Service

Other showtimes:

August 25 at 8:15 PM

*Presented in the original Japanese with English subtitles*

Back by popular demand, the Williams Center invites you to “Studio Ghibli Sundays,” a year-long series in which we dedicate one night a week to screening and celebrating the works of Studio Ghibli.

Recently reappraised as a prescient fable on the highs and lows of the gig economy, Miyazaki’s adaptation of the 1985 novel chronicles a young witch’s coming of age as she moves to a big city and begins a courier service. Though a more intimate story coming off of Miyazaki’s prior efforts for Studio Ghibli, it is no less affecting, anchored in a young woman’s journey into independence but still glistening with oceanside vistas and city still-lifes.

View Event →

We Are X

Some may not be familiar with X Japan, yet their comprehensive documentary We Are X proves their storied history and ardent fanbase would rival most American rock groups. The film explores their unique and tumultuous journey, from their early history as progenitors of visual kei (Japan’s equivalent to glam rock), to the devastating losses of bandmates hide and Taiji, to even frontman Yoshiki’s near-debilitating health problems, all culminating in an epic performance at Madison Square Garden.

Other showtimes:

August 26 at 8:00 PM

View Event →

Lupin III: The Fuma Conspiracy

This fourth entry in the long-running anime series sees gentleman thief Lupin III taking on hero duties when Goemon’s fiancée is kidnapped by ninjas and held for ransom. Lupin and his gang, including accomplices Jigen and Fujiko, vow to rescue her, while the always-bumbling police inspector Zenigata goes hot on Lupin’s trail. Though it drew controversy for replacing the series’ voice talent and composer, The Fuma Conspiracy is considered to have some of the best animation in the series.Animation Elevation,80s Anime Showcase

View Event →

The Williams Center presents a weekly open-mic, $5 for spectators and participants.

Nothing is off-limits, and we encourage artists of all disciplines and ages to come and hone their craft. Poetry, spoken word, singer song-writers, comedy and more! Performers will be in the Williams Center's "Spring Hall".

*Performers, Please make sure to identify your act when you get your ticket. Time slots are five minutes per artists, so please plan your acts accordingly. Make sure to fill out THIS FORM after purchasing a ticket!

View Event →

Ashes and Diamonds

Beginning on the last day of WWII, a soldier reckons with his code of ethics after being instructed to kill a local secretary. Told through phenomenal choreography and lush black and white cinematography, Ashes and Diamonds is perhaps one of the most famous pieces of Polish cinema, led by suave lead performance from Zbigniew Cybulski.

View Event →

Third Seven at Soldato in The Williams Center

Join us on August 28th for an unforgettable evening at the Soldato Books & Records store Lounge. We're excited to present a special performance by Third Seven, the international touring one-man cello artist from Oregon, led by the talented Billy Mickelson.

With over 20 years of international touring and performing experience, Third Seven has captivated audiences across 16 countries. His boundless, adaptable, and uniquely approachable style transcends genres, making his music a perfect fit for any setting, from punk rock shows to yoga classes.

Billy Mickelson's performances are renowned for their honesty, vulnerability, and storytelling. Using looping and layering techniques with cello, percussion, and vocals, he creates an engaging and immersive experience. His dedication to excellence ensures a flawless, memorable, and thought-provoking performance for all.

Doors open at 7:30pm, and the show begins at 8pm. Tickets are $15 for general admission. Don't miss this chance to witness the one-of-a-kind musical journey of Third Seven!

We're looking forward to seeing you at the Soldato Books & Records store Lounge in the Williams Center, Rutherford, NJ!

Doors Open: 7:30pm | Show Starts: 8pm

Tickets: $15 GA

View Event →

A weekly casual gathering in the Atrium of the 100-year old Williams Center of Rutherford, NJ. The event is centered around playing contemporary boardgames of various types. Bring a game and a friend!

Here is a list of our current boardgames: https://docs.google.com/document/d/12xLd0a7dCjyqgVpD8a_7X66ZdIAfxonv-Dr4yQx9qSc/edit?usp=sharing

350 Studios: Live Sessions

Join 350 Studios on August 31st for their summer festival including: live music, vendors, food trucks, drinks, and workshops!

350 Studios is a media production company that has worked with musicians and small businesses for over 3 years. In 2023, they decided to venture into event curation with the idea to bring together their clients under one roof to put on a show and exclusive pop-up shops for their combined audiences.

Now in 2024, they’re back again, even bigger and better turning their 4-hour live show into a full day summer festival. The goal is to bring artists and small businesses from all over NJ to Rutherford for a can’t-miss event. More artists, more vendors, and this year they’re adding food trucks and various workshops including learning how to do henna, jewelry-making, and concert photography and videography masterclasses.

All of this for an unbeatable price of $15 (Early bird ticket) for all-day all-access to the 350 Studios: Live Sessions at the Williams Center. Workshops start at an additional price of $20. Come enjoy the end of the summer as 350 Studios and the Williams Center collaborate for the first time on this all-inclusive summer festival.

Event Activities

Workshops and Panels:

Anum Kazmi is a henna artist. She is the teacher in charge of the Henna Club at her school and has hosted events with residents of the Newark Urby teaching people of all ages how to do henna art

Sydney Bell is a jewelry designer. For many years she’s hosted classes for kids and adults, teaching them how to make bracelets, earrings, necklaces and rings. Most recently she collaborated with Newark restaurant The Yard on a monthly workshop where she provided materials and tools for people to make their own jewelry that they then took home.

Paulo Rojas has been doing event videography for over 6 years. He has learned the ins and outs of capturing the best moments and has taken his talents to capture concerts of all sizes. This workshop would include a masterclass on concert videography as well as a media pass to help workshop attendees grow their portfolio.

Rock Jennings has been a concert photographer for over 10 years. During this time, he has gotten to photograph some of the biggest artists at some of the biggest music festivals. He has worked with Paulo for 5 years and together they have photographed and taken video of many concerts in New Jersey. This workshop would include a masterclass on concert photography as well as a media pass to help workshop attendees grow their portfolio.

Community Engagement:

Collaborate with the local Rutherford Food Bank to set up a donation from 350 Studios

Ticket Pricing:

$15 Early Bird (until August 1st)

$20 General Admission

Vendor Ticket Pricing:

$75 indoor table 8ft (10 total tickets)

$100 outdoor table 8ft (15 total tickets)

All Vendors must bring their own table

Event Schedule:

Doors open at 12pm for outdoor DJ, vendor shopping and workshops

Live music starts at 2pm in the Black Box

Live music ends around 6/7pm

DJ plays until doors close at 8pm

View Event →

All-Star Comedy Lineup: The Next Big Thing

*Doors at 8pm, Show at 8:30pm*

Hatem Gabr presents The Next Big Thing, an All-Star Standup Comedy Show, starring some of the nation's hottest comedians.

Two nights a month at the Williams Center!

Derek Humphrey

Derek Humphrey has been featured in the New York Comedy Festival, Gilda's Laughfest and been named one of "New York's Funniest" by TBS. Derek's acting work has included campaigns for Gillette, with appearances on MTV and ABC - from the Off- Broadway hit show " Race: The Movie, The Play".

Lou Perez

Comedian, writer, and producer. Lou is a regular on Gutfeld!, Fox, and Open to Debate. He's the author of bestseller “That Joke Isn't Funny Anymore” and his writing appears in The Wall Street Journal, The Spectator, and Spiked magazine. Lou hosts The Lou Perez Podcast and The Wrong Take debate series. Lou was the head writer and producer of the Webby Award-winning comedy channel We the Internet TV and produces Comedy Is Murder with Free the People.

Boris Khaykin

Listed by Time Out NY as one of Brooklyn Comedy Festival’s Biggest Stars. He’s been seen in Bull, Broad City, The First Purge, Amazon Prime’s Red Oaks, and The Opposition on Comedy Central. Boris is a regular guest on The Comedy Cellar’s Live from America Podcast and can be heard on the Audible/Broadway Video podcast series Blood Weed. He's also won a webby for his work as a writer/director at We the Internet, Boris Khaykin came to America as a refugee from Ukraine before it was cool.

Bryan McKenna

Bryan is a Stand Up Comedian from New York, NY. Bryan has been featured in the LaughYourAshvilleOFF Comedy Festival, a finalist in the Carolines on Broadway March Madness Competition, as well as a finalist at The Boston Comedy Festival in 2021. He has been seen touring nationally opening for Jim Breuer and in March 2020 Bryan’s 1st album, Jim Breuer Presents Bryan McKenna “The Fight is Never Over” under the label Virtual Comedy Network debuted at #1 on iTunes. When he isn’t touring Bryan performs nightly at various NYC comedy clubs such as Broadway Comedy Club, Carolines on Broadway, and Eastville Comedy Club. The weirdest part about this bio is that Bryan wrote it, yet he still wrote it in the 3rd person.

*Line up is subject to change without notice.*

Studio Ghibli Sundays: Only Yesterday

Other showtimes:

September 1 at 8:30 PM

*Presented in the original Japanese with English subtitles*

Back by popular demand, the Williams Center invites you to “Studio Ghibli Sundays,” a year-long series in which we dedicate one night a week to screening and celebrating the works of Studio Ghibli.

Isao Takahata’s second feature for Studio Ghibli, following his harrowing war drama Grave of the Fireflies, continues his focus on intimate family drama sans supernatural flourish. Taeko, a career-driven woman living in Tokyo, decides to take a reprieve from city life and visit her in-laws in the rural town of Yamagata. Colored by both pleasant and painful memories of her own childhood, Taeko’s visit brings new appreciation for the charm of farm life as well as a connection with handsome local Toshio.

View Event →

The Last Waltz

A fitting final rodeo for our series, Martin Scorsese’s farewell to one of rock’s greatest groups is an essential work of visual and sonic splendor. Seven 35mm cameras document The Band’s star-studded final concert, capturing every moment of the group’s passionate stage presence alongside interactions with special guests like Bob Dylan and Mavis Staples. Scorsese stitches interviews with the bandmates in between songs, revealing sobering insights from the group as they approach their twilight.

Other showtimes:

September 2 at 8:30 PM

View Event →

Wicked City

This controversial horror anime blends monstrous creature designs with sexploitation to create a seminal work of gothic fantasy noir. Set in a universe in which humans and demons coexist, two officers, one human and one demon, are tasked with protecting a diplomat set to maintain peace. However, the duo must contend with forces at hand who strive to disrupt the peace, all the while discovering a romantic connection that could save both of their species.

View Event →

The Cranes Are Flying

Winner of the Palme d’Or at the 1958 Cannes Film Festival, the camera practically flies off the screen in this visceral war romance. The Soviet era classic recounts “The Patriotic War” through the eyes of Veronica and Boris, two impassioned lovers caught in the crossfire of a country engaging in a war far beyond its own ambitions.

ProgStock Presents: PAKT and Jane Getter Premonition

A Night of Prog Rock, Jazz Fusion, and Experimental Music!

PAKT, a true super group of master musicians merging & colliding new music in the realms of progressive rock, electric jazz, experimental, ambient, psychedelic and beyond, is an experience as much as a musical project. An IMAX film for the ears, PAKT takes its listeners on an improvised sonic voyage with no preconceived destination, minimal pre-planning and little use for forms and conventions. Rare is the musician who can thrive in such a spontaneous environment but Percy Jones (fretless bass guitar), Alex Skolnick (guitar), Kenny Grohowski (drums) and Tim Motzer (guitar and electronics) are all up to the task. Armed with enough tastefully used effects to stock a small music store, Motzer and Skolnick create sounds so atmospheric and ethereal that one might not guess their source is a guitar. Meanwhile, Grohowski and Jones approach their instruments in textural manners that seamlessly intertwine with each other and the quartet as a whole. The music runs the gamut from highly sensitive to intense, with all four musicians’ listening skills so strong that their collective playing is as cohesive as it is unpredictable. Welsh bassist Jones (now a New York resident) is known for his tenure in the legendary jazz fusion group Brand X (whose classic lineup included drummer Phil Collins, yes that one) and extensive studio work (especially with Brian Eno). Skolnick is a diverse improviser whose jazz and world playing and instrumental associations (including bass virtuosos Stuart Hamm and Michael Manring) forms a Jeckyll & Hyde dynamic with his high profile as lead guitarist of the metal band Testament. Grohowski's many recent associations include John Zorn, a reincarnated version of Brand X and masked avant-metal outfit, Imperial Triumphant. Motzer has a long background in free improvisation, including the bands Bandit65 (with fellow guitarist Kurt Rosenwinkel) and Orion Tango, plus many other recorded collaborations for his 1k Recordings label.

Jane Getter Premonition has carved out a niche at the intersection of jazz, metal, rock and singer-songwriter with masterful playing of Getter’s “complex, sophisticated, and dynamic” compositions (All About Jazz). On tour, JGP has dazzled audiences at ProgStock, Outreach Music Festival (Austria), San Francisco Jazz Festival, bFlat Bar (India), Guitar City (Poland), Borderline (UK), North Sea Jazz Club (Netherlands) Iridium, and opened for Allan Holdsworth and Brand X. According to the ProgReport, JGP is “a stunning prog rock/jazz fusion outfit reminiscent of stylistic darlings like King Crimson and The Mahavishnu Orchestra”. The all-star band is led by guitarist, singer and award winning composer Jane Getter and features keyboardist Adam Holzman (Miles Davis, Steven Wilson), guitarist Alex Skolnick (Testament, Trans-Siberian Orchestra), Rutherford resident bassist and singer Paul Frazier (David Byrne, Nile Rodgers) and drummer Gene Lake (David Sanborn, Nile Rodgers and Chic).

Office Hours: A Roundtable Discussion for Rounding Out Ideas

Williams Center Presents:

'Office Hours: A Roundtable Discussion for Rounding Out Ideas'

Do you feel like you have an idea for a script / book / poem / song, and you just don't know how to get it off the ground? Or maybe you have a completed piece of work, and you simply want another person to give some honest feedback? Starting this August, the Williams Center is offering a brand-new forum for just that: your ideas!

We proudly present "Office Hours," an open-door, collaborative forum that helps each member work through the ideation, creation, and revisions of their latest artistic endeavor! It's a bi-weekly, two hour session where you can bring anything to the table, and you'll be met with full attention and constructive feedback.

To clarify, it is a group built on kindness, open-mindedness and timeliness — while everyone will have a chance to comment on each other's work, there will be proper guidelines and time constraints to give everyone a chance to share (more on that later). And to further clarify, you do not have to bring something for every session. Come and go as you please, and feel free to be in the room without the caveat of something you're working on.

All in all, we want this to feel like a meeting place for creatives who just want to be around other working creatives. While the focus might lean towards screenwriting or prose, we are open to all kinds of art, and this group will morph with time and experience.

Consider this your opportunity to get some work done — and let us help you get it there!

View Event →

Studio Ghibli Sundays: Porco Rosso

Other showtimes:

September 8 at 8 PM

*Presented in the original Japanese with English subtitles*

Back by popular demand, the Williams Center invites you to “Studio Ghibli Sundays,” a year-long series in which we dedicate one night a week to screening and celebrating the works of Studio Ghibli.

Hayao Miyazaki’s passion for aviation, a subtle motif throughout his previous works, takes center stage in this postwar drama starring a World War I fighter pilot turned bounty hunter. Cursed to live with a pig’s head, he remains on the run from government forces while taking down local pirates, that is until a new pilot challenges him to a dogfight that forces him to confront his past. As much a showcase for Miyazaki’s knowledge of period aircraft as it is a rebuke of fascism, Porco Rosso is a lesser-seen gem in Miyazaki’s filmography.

View Event →

On the Bowery

American neorealist Lionel Rogosin documents three days in the drinking life of Ray Salyer, a railroad worker, as he passes from bar, to church, to homeless shelter in New York’s Bowery community. One of the nominees for Best Documentary Feature at the Academy Awards, this underseen gem captures a community with rare access and, ironically, sobering insight.

Studio Ghibli Sundays: Ocean Waves

Other showtimes:

September 15 at 7:30 PM

*Presented in the original Japanese with English subtitles*

Back by popular demand, the Williams Center invites you to “Studio Ghibli Sundays,” a year-long series in which we dedicate one night a week to screening and celebrating the works of Studio Ghibli.

This rarely-screened television movie was the first Studio Ghibli film not directed by either Hayao Miyazaki or Isao Takahata. Instead, a then-young but still experienced animator, Tomomi Mochizuki, was tapped to direct this high school romance about two friends, Taku and Yutaka, who befriend and eventually develop feelings for the same transfer student, Rikako. Naturally, tensions flare between the trio, however the film’s impressionistic animation makes for a subtle, moving drama that stands in contrast to the genre’s mostly melodramatic fare.

Artist, educator, and filmmaker Gerard Amsellem is an American and French citizen whose special interests lie in classic, foreign and independent films from all over the world.

The Especially Everyone Experience

The Especially Everyone Experience is an inclusive, interactive musical experience that encourages participation from people of all abilities. Facilitated by a 10-piece ensemble, the performance explores a variety of ways to involve the audience, including teaching the lyrics to sing songs, sharing dance moves, and even inviting guests on the stage to take solos on a custom built instrument, 'The Magical Music Machine'. Sensory accommodations are made through sound and light design, as well as a sensory-break area away from the music for anyone that may need to take a break during the show.

Come check out The Especially Everyone Experience and make music with us!

Ticket Prices: $25

The Defending Champions - “Victory Lap Launch Party”

VICTORY LAP LAUNCH PARTY

This show is a celebration of 17 years as a band and a celebration of our new vinyl release "Victory Lap"

We're also pumped to announce a special collaboration w/ Four City Brewery, The Defending Champions "Victory Lap Pilsner" will be available (in cans) for the first time on 9/27 at the Williams Center bar! The beer cans will feature the artwork from our new vinyl release "Victory Lap". This is a special collaboration featured ONLY AT OUR RELEASE SHOWS so don't miss out and book your tickets now! Pre-sale only $20, night of $25 at the door.

The Defending Champions are: Matt Ryan - Lead Vocals/Trombone, Dean Nevolis - Guitar/Vocals, Matt Schoenebaum - Saxaphones, Jovan Alvarez - Trumpet/Percussion, Eric Swiontkowski Bass/vocals, Jeff Fernandes - Drums/Vocals.

Hailing from the great state of New Jersey, The Defending Champions are a 6-piece original band that’s been playing throughout the tri-state area for over 17 years. We appeal to a wide audience and are best described as a horn-driven, high energy melting pot of American R&B, Rock n’ Roll, Ska and global party music.

Throughout our 17 years we’ve been honored to share the stage with musical acts such as WAR, The Smithereens, Russell Batiste Jr., The Slackers, World Inferno Friendship Society, Mephiskapheles, The Pietasters, New York Ska Jazz Ensemble and many more.

Openers:

Black Flamingos are an instrumental trio from Asbury Park, NJ - featuring Robbie Butkowski on guitar, Declan O’Connell on bass, and Hi-Tide Recordings co-owner Vincent Minervino on drums.

The band has toured extensively, supporting Dick Dale, The Ventures, Los Straitjackets, Messer Chups & more, with festival appearances at The Hukilau, Surf Guitar 101 Convention, & Hi-Tide Summer Holiday.

Widely Grown is an Americana/AltFolk band from Jersey City, New Jersey. Widely Grown released their debut album in the summer of 2022 and toured 9 states to follow. The Widely Grown boys are known for their energetic live performances that contain their unique blend of rock, country, grass and soul. 2023 saw them travelin’ again, performing at the Barefoot Country Music Festival, Maplewoodstock, touring through 6 states and performing for the legendary throw down at Miguels Pizza celebration in Kentucky.

2024 has them releasing NEW MUSIC. an EP recorded live at Thundersound Studios in Kentucky. Mississippi Anna dropped March 8th! This EP takes off where Pickles left off. It’s fun. Doesn’t take itself too seriously. James wrote a batch of tunes that emulate the live energy of their shows currently. Big analog sounds.

Progstock 2024

What is ProgStock, exactly?

ProgStock’s main stage will feature music that most radio hosts would find to be too long and too complex to play on-the-air. Dancing in 7/8, indeed, is left to fans who are accustomed to calculating high math in their heads. It’s easy to assume — because even the massive force of Apple Music doesn’t feature a decent Prog option — that the genre is dead. Alas, the Internet is largely credited for bringing together Prog’s most loyal and growing fandom.

This three-day volunteer-run festival was founded to solve a few positive problems. First, even though a handful of fun Prog gatherings exist around the globe, artists are eager to play in the Northeast United States during the autumn months, where and when not much else in Prog circles takes place. Second, we know that Prog fans are seeking a comfortable, classy venue to see their favorite bands perform. Add in a great arts-friendly environment that’s close to a huge airport and regional rail transportation…and that’s most of ProgStock’s story. The only thing we need for this to be complete is…You! And with you, there will be much rejoicing at The American Northeast’s Only International Progressive Rock Festival, ProgStock.

We are incredibly pleased to bring this festival to you together with our partners at the House of Prog Internet Radio station, and the NJProghouse Progressive Music Series. We are enormously grateful for their support for, endorsement of, and participation in this Herculean endeavor.

Visit 2024 Schedule Here | Check 2024 Artists Here

Rocco and His Brothers

Clocking in at over three hours, this epic Italian family drama went on to influence Italian-American directors like Francis Ford Coppola and Martin Scorsese. Following the death of their family patriarch, a group of rural Southerners attempt to adapt to city life in the north, one of whom through boxing. Featuring a young Alain Delon and Claudia Cardinale, this stirring sports movie is gritty, exciting and breathtaking.

Patlabor: The Movie

Set in a unique timeline within the Mobile Police Patlabor franchise, Patlabor: The Movie sees Japan dominated by Labors, large robot suits built to help Japan recover from ecological disaster. When a group of them unexpectedly go haywire, the Patrol Labors, or Patlabors, are assigned to investigate, where they discover a deadly master plan. Mamoru’s exploration of the intersection between humanity and technology would pave the way for his later, seminal work, Ghost in the Shell.

View Event →

Monterey Pop

For a double whammy of Pennebaker, check out Monterey Pop, one of cinema’s seminal concert films and a distilled look at 60s counterculture by way of the music that mobilized it. Before Woodstock, there was the Monterey International Pop Festival, where an assortment of music giants, everyone from Jimi Hendrix to Janis Joplin to Simon and Garfunkel, would perform now-legendary live sets. Pennebaker’s spontaneous, lightning-in-a-bottle live-wire kickstarted the next decade’s rebellious spirit with a bang.

Studio Ghibli Sundays: Castle in the Sky

Other showtimes:

August 11 at 8:30 PM

*Presented in the original Japanese with English subtitles*

Back by popular demand, the Williams Center invites you to “Studio Ghibli Sundays,” a year-long series in which we dedicate one night a week to screening and celebrating the works of Studio Ghibli.

The first Studio Ghibli film proper, this is another fantasy-lade adventure mixing motifs of nature and technology. However, this film introduces Miyazaki’s focus on the perspectives of children; Sheeta, a young girl holding a mysterious power via her crystal necklace, meets Pazu, a humble mechanic longing to visit a mythical land floating in the sky. As the two realize their paths are connected, they must reckon with evil forces seeking to manipulate Sheeta’s power for their own self-serving gain.

Nola Bunny Burlesque at the Williams Center

Join The Nola Bunny Productions crew at The Williams Center on August 10th as they take you into the jungle to celebrate Leo Season. Put on your leopard print dress, flower headbands, and tropical button downs, and immerse yourself in the fierce routines by our beautiful burlesque stars.

Show time is at 9:00 PM, and doors open at 8:00 PM so you can arrive early to claim your front row seat, and don’t forget to bring your tips for our performers.

Not sure what to wear? No worries. Nola Bunny Vintage will have a lush display of clothing and accessories to bring your lavish look to life.

And if you happen to arrive feeling super-slothy or slightly-sheepish, Michael Pop will be giving Lion Lessons to help you loosen those loins and stride with pride!

Location: William Center in Rutherford, New Jersey.

Tickets: $20 (Advanced tickets suggested to ensure entry upon arrival.)

Meet the artists:

Nola Bunny, a NYC/NJ-based entertainer, has been performing all over the tri-state area for the past decade, specializing in burlesque with elements of neo, fetish and conceptual performance art. Bringing her performances to life with props and vintage costuming, audiences are carried away to her world of fantasy.

She has appeared in Uncle Floyd’s Traveling Burlesque Show, AHZ Concepts’ LUST NYC, and the historic Stonewall Inn. With enchanting eye contact, charisma, and tantalizing suspense, Nola Bunny is sure to make your heart race.

Magnifique is New Jersey’s very own bro-lesque superstar. With preen and poise, he’s not like the other boys and is sure to have you mesmerized. See why his fun and upbeat performances make him a crowd favorite!

Tiffani Monroe is BROOKLYN'S BUMP AND GRIND! Gogo Girl, Burlesque Starlet, and Producer, Tiffani Monroe can be found shimmying and shaking for your entertainment every weekend at The Box and at her very own show “Beehives N’ Bouffants” every Third Thursday of the month at the world famous Beauty Bar.

While Michael Klimovich (aka Michael Pop!) has been a musician for most of his life, in 2017, Nola Bunny brought him back on stage in a new role as a partner in performance art. Reactivating his creativity for character development, lessons

from long-ago acting classes, and passion for costume and prop creation, he became an integral asset to her creative visions. Numerous new acts came to life in a short time for this dynamic duo. From romantic to comedic, and risqué to

downright shocking, their role-play dramatizations were well received and performed regularly at nightlife and fetish events in New York City and New Jersey, which then traveled far and wide to conventions and festivals around the United

States.

Sideshow Scandal is the most shameless clown in burlesque. This showgirl is on a perpetual sugar rush, and looking for trouble. With her bouncy energy and jubilant charm, she is sure to win your heart.

Rob Cannillo at The Williams Center

Join us on August 10th to see the outstanding performance of Rob Cannillo in an outdoors event at the Williams center courtyard!

Show time: 6 PM

Tickets: $15

Rob Cannillo is a singer/songwriter whose gritty vocal style and distinctive Americana compositions speak from the heart, engaging thousands of listeners across the U.S.Rob, whose music has been described by WPDH DJ Robyn Taylor as “magic” and by former Lynyrd Skynyrd drummer Artimus Pyle as “killer,” is a self-taught musician who burst onto the Hudson Valley entertainment scene and quickly became one of the area’s premier artists. Rob’s melodies evoke the sounds of other popular indie/Americana artists such as The Avett Brothers, John Mayer, Jack Johnson, Ray LaMontagne, The Lumineers, and Amos Lee.Rob Cannillo is a passionate, earthy performer his devoted fans have come to love.

Sirocco and the Kingdom of Winds (2023) SUB

One day, the adventurous Juliette and her sister Carmen find an enchanted toy and get swept away into the Kingdom of Winds. They are transformed into cats and find themselves in a fantastical new world full of flying divas, technicolor dragons, and other mind-melting creations. When Juliette causes an accident that draws the ire of the local inhabitants, the Mayor gives Juliette to the beautiful songstress Selma and sentences Carmen to marry his son as punishment. The sisters must find a way to escape before the wedding bells ring, but the key to their journey home lies with Sirocco, the mysterious wizard feared for his ferocious storms.

A psychedelic fairy tale years in the making comes from the imagination of director Benoît Chieux. With captivating creatures and a vibrant Seussian world, Sirocco and the Kingdom of Winds is a kaleidoscopic fantasy adventure bursting with charm and wonder.

Eastern Promises

After a teenage girl dies during childbirth, midwife Anna Khitrova begins to read through the girl's diary in an attempt to return the child to her biological family. Her search brings her dangerously close to a violent Russian crime family with more than a few secrets. Brutal and stark, Viggo Mortensen's Academy Award-nominated performance is commanding, as is director David Cronenberg’s departure from body horror in favor of more brooding, humanistic drama.

The Connection

One of the first films directed by a woman of the New American Film Movement and one of first-ever found-footage films, The Connection sees a group of heroin addicts anxiously awaiting for their next fix to be delivered. The film highlights drug addiction with piercing honesty in gorgeous black and white cinematography, accompanied by memorable performances by pianist Freddie Redd and saxophonist Jackie McLean.

View Event →

Royal Space Force: The Wings of Honnêamise

One of the most legendary cult anime films of all time. This deeply humanistic sci-fi drama centers on an astronaut who, inspired by a devout local woman, volunteers to be the first man in space. However, his mission is threatened by political corruption and the threat of war with a neighboring nation. Royal Space Force received mixed reception upon release but has since been reappraised as a formative beginning for Neon Genesis Evangelion studio Gainax.

Don't Look Back

Our series would not be complete without the work of D.A. Pennebaker, the master documentarian who pioneered the raw and observational “direct cinema” movement of the early 60s. In his first of many collaborations with musician Bob Dylan (not to mention the first of many music documentaries), Pennebaker sets his lens on Dylan’s 1965 UK concert tour and the surrounding social upheaval of the era. Capturing the musician as candidly on-stage and he does off, Don’t Look Back is a uniquely unfiltered look at Bob Dylan’s artistry and outlook and a must-see for longtime fans.

View Event →

Don't Look Back

Studio Ghibli Sundays: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind

Other showtimes:

August 4 at 8:30 PM

*Presented in the original Japanese with English subtitles*

Back by popular demand, the Williams Center invites you to “Studio Ghibli Sundays,” a year-long series in which we dedicate one night a week to screening and celebrating the works of Studio Ghibli.

Before they were Studio Ghibli, they were Topcraft, a humble anime studio hired by Hayao Miyazaki to helm an adaptation of his own manga. The result, Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind, was a massive success and led to Studio Ghibli’s founding one year after its release. Centered on a courageous princess (a female heroine vastly ahead of her time) who must save her world from nuclear destruction, it features many of what are now considered the studio’s trademarks: sweeping fantasy action, environmentalist themes, and grandiose score by Joe Hisaishi.

View Event →

Office Hours: A Roundtable Discussion for Rounding Out Ideas

Williams Center Presents:

'Office Hours: A Roundtable Discussion for Rounding Out Ideas'

Do you feel like you have an idea for a script / book / poem / song, and you just don't know how to get it off the ground? Or maybe you have a completed piece of work, and you simply want another person to give some honest feedback? Starting this August, the Williams Center is offering a brand-new forum for just that: your ideas!

We proudly present "Office Hours," an open-door, collaborative forum that helps each member work through the ideation, creation, and revisions of their latest artistic endeavor! It's a bi-weekly, two hour session where you can bring anything to the table, and you'll be met with full attention and constructive feedback.

To clarify, it is a group built on kindness, open-mindedness and timeliness — while everyone will have a chance to comment on each other's work, there will be proper guidelines and time constraints to give everyone a chance to share (more on that later). And to further clarify, you do not have to bring something for every session. Come and go as you please, and feel free to be in the room without the caveat of something you're working on.

All in all, we want this to feel like a meeting place for creatives who just want to be around other working creatives. While the focus might lean towards screenwriting or prose, we are open to all kinds of art, and this group will morph with time and experience.

Consider this your opportunity to get some work done — and let us help you get it there!

Tickets here

Snatch

Guy Ritchie's hilarious crime comedy that weaves its several storylines around a stolen diamond and an unlicensed boxing match. which send ripples through London's underworld. With an ensemble cast including Brad Pitt, Jason Statham, and Benicio Del Toro, the film is sharp, showcasing Ritchie's distinctive directing flair which has made a mark on English cinema.

View Event →

Robot Dreams

In this charming yet deeply-felt animated drama, a lonely dog living in 1980s New York City builds himself a new friend in the form of a naive, curious robot. As the two begin fostering a beautiful friendship, one tragic event separates them, forcing the pair to imagine a world without one another. Told with minimal dialogue but a host of memorable needle drops, Robot Dreams is a tale about more than just friendship, but the emotional ties that bind us forever. Nominated for Best Animated Feature at the 2023 Academy Awards.

Other Showtimes:

Wednesday, July 31 at 8:15 PM

Heaven and Earth Magic

Cut-out animation, using images from 19th century catalogues. Also referred to as Film #12, the animation was assembled over the course of several years, edited and reworked along the way. Musique concrète soundtrack. Harry Smith describes the film as follows, “The first part depicts the heroine’s toothache consequent to the loss of a very valuable watermelon, her dentistry and transportation to heaven. Next follows an elaborate exposition of the heavenly land, in terms of Israel, Montreal and the second part depicts the return to Earth from being eaten by Max Muller on the day Edward the Seventh dedicated the Great Sewer of London.”

Williams Center Open Mic

The Williams Center presents a weekly open-mic, $5 for spectators and participants.

Nothing is off-limits, and we encourage artists of all disciplines and ages to come and hone their craft. Poetry, spoken word, singer song-writers, comedy and more! Performers will be in the Williams Center's "Spring Hall".

*Performers, Please make sure to identify your act when you get your ticket. Time slots are five minutes per artists, so please plan your acts accordingly. Make sure to fill out THIS FORM after purchasing a ticket!

Five Star Stories

In a distant galaxy, those in possession of the elegant combat machines known as Mortar Headds hold great prestige and power. That is, assuming they also own a Fatima, genetically engineered women who are required for Mortar Headds to operate at full capacity. A young man named Ladios Sopp arrives on one of the five stars that make up the Joker system to look for a particular Fatima: Lachesis, who he promised to make his bride.

Amazing Grace

In 1972, Sydney Pollack filmed vocal powerhouse Aretha Franklin recording her transplendent gospel album Amazing Grace with the help of the Southern California Community Choir. Technical issues kept the footage in the vault for over 30 years, that is until film producer Alan Elliott restored it to its proper glory and released it in collaboration with Franklin’s estate less than a year after her death. The resulting effort stands as a memorial to the vocalist and her immense talents, captured with stunning visual and sonic clarity against the backdrop of a lively, dynamic church audience.

View Event →
